1.text: "Everybody in this country should learn how to program a computer...

and when people found out they laughed at me

The whole limit in the system is that 
there just aren't enough people who are

241.text:
>>HADI: Created Code.Org
Whether you're trying to make a lot of money 
or whether you just want to change the world,

245.text: Computer programming is an incredibly empowering skill to learn.

249.text: I think if someone had told me that

252.text: software is really about humanity, that it's really about helping people

259.text: it would have changed my outlook a lot earlier.

263.text: To be able to actually come up with an idea and then see it in your hands and then be able to press a button

268.text: and have it be in millions of people hands, I mean, I think we're the first

272.text: generation in the world that's really ever had that kind of experience.

276.text: Just to think that you can start something in your college dorm room and you can have a set of people

281.text: who haven't built a big company before come together and build something that

285.text: a billion people use as part of their daily lives...

288.text: It's crazy to think about, right? It's really, it's humbling and it's amazing.

291.text: The programmers of tomorrow are the wizards of the future.

294.text:
You know, you're going look like you have magic powers
compared to everybody else.

298.text: It's amazing. It's, it's the closest thing we have to a super power.

303.text: Great coders are today's Rock Stars.  That's it!

309.text: 1 million of the best jobs in America may go unfilled...

312.text: ...because only 1 in 4 schools teach students how to code.

315.text: Whether you want to be a doctor or a rockstar,

317.text: ask about a coding class at your school
